DisplayString.Name: System Center Core Monitoring Reports
DisplayString.Description: This management pack defines reports used for analysis and planning related to System Center Core Monitoring.

DisplayString.Name: Data Volume by Management Pack
DisplayString.Description: This report shows detail information for data volume by management pack during specified time interval.

DisplayString.Name: Click on plus sign to see a full description for this report
Data Volumes by management pack in a chosen timeframe.
Please select a valid value, greater than 0, for the Show Top parameter.

DisplayString.Description: This report shows detail information for data volume details by management pack during specified time interval.

Please select a valid value, greater than 0, for the Show Top parameter.
Counts by Discovered Type, Rule or Monitor
Agent Counts by Date, Management Group and Version

Agent counts by date, management group and version in a chosen timeframe.

Agents by Health State
DisplayString.Description: This report provides lists of agents, broken down by their current health state, as it is currently recorded in the data warehouse.

DisplayString.Name: Click on plus sign to see a full description for this report
This report provides lists of agents, broken down by their current health state, as it is currently recorded in the data warehouse.
Systems in this state are not communicating with the management group, and have not been sending a heartbeat.
Confirm these systems are online and that the health service is in a running state.
For more details troubleshooting guidance, refer to the knowledge base article 2288515
The critical state means that the majority of the agent's functionality is impaired or stopped completely.
To identify the issue(s) that are causing the critical state open the health explorer and review the monitors in a critical state.
The product knowledge tab on the top right-hand side of the health explorer will provide more detail about the problem and how to resolve it.
The warning state means that the agent is working but is either partially impaired or it is not configured correctly.
The success state means that the agent is working and configured correctly.
To identify the issue(s) that are causing the warning state open the health explorer for the agent and review all monitors that are in a warning state.
The product knowledge tab of the health explorer will provide more detail about the problem and how to resolve it.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Data Volume by Management Pack report compiles information on the volume of data generated by management packs. The report lists the number of occurrences per management pack for the following data types:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Discoveries
Alerts
Performance (number of instances submitted for performance counters collected by management pack)
Events
State changes

maml:section.maml:para: The purpose of this report is to provide insight into which management packs are driving the data volumes in your environment so that you can establish baselines and identify opportunities for tuning. From this report, you can obtain more specific details per management pack, using the Data Volumes by Workflow and Instance report. (See the "Additional Information" section below for more information.)

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: You can use the following parameters to customize the results of the Data Volume by Management Pack report:

maml:listItem.maml:para: From: The date and time provided in this parameter will be used as the start time for the report.
To: The date and time provided in this parameter will be used as the end time of the report.
Time Zone: This parameter is used to indicate which time zone to use for the from and to parameters.

Aggregation: This parameter sets the interval that will be used for aggregating the report results. The options provided are Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly. It is recommended that you use larger aggregations for larger time spans to ensure the charts provided in the report are readable.
Data types: This parameter controls which types of data to include in the volume calculations. Consider the following uses for this parameter:
Including all data types will provide a report that shows total volumes. This can be used to pinpoint management packs and data types are contributing the most to volumes.
Selecting a single data type allows for a more focused data volume analysis, such as identifying top alert-generating management packs or top discovery data-generating management packs.

Show Top: The value passed in this parameter is used to limit the number of management packs returned in the report results. For example, a value of "10" will limit the report results to the top 10 management packs. After the total data volumes are calculated for the data types selected, the list or management packs is sorted by total volume and filtered to include only the top # number of rows, where # is the value provided in this parameter

Management group: Use this list to select the management groups for which data should be queried from the data warehouse. By default, this list includes all of the management groups which have data in the data warehouse.

Management packs: Use this parameter to select one, several, or all management packs to be included in the report. By default, all management packs for which there is data in the data warehouse are included.

maml:section.maml:title: Additional Information
maml:section.maml:para: The Data Volume by Management Pack report table summarizes the following information:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Percent of total data volume per management pack. The values that are displayed are rounded to 2 decimals. The grand total is computed using raw values. The Count by Management Pack total is the total for the rows displayed.

Trend. An arrow (up, down, or sideways) indicates that the volume of data during the period of the report is increasing, decreasing, or stable. The grand total row indicates that the total volume of data is increasing, decreasing, or stable.

maml:section.maml:para: The remaining columns provide a count of each data item type.
In the Data Volume by Management Pack report, you can:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Click a management pack name to render the Data Volume By Management Pack report for that management pack only.
Click a cell in the table to open a Data Volume by Workflow and Instance report for that management pack and data type.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Data Volume by Workflow and Instance report compiles information on the volume of data generated, broken down by workflows (discoveries, rules, monitors, etc.) as well as by instances. There are two ways to access this report:

maml:listItem.maml:para: In the Data Volume by Management Pack, click one of the counts cells in the table at the top of the report to open the Data Volume by Workflow and Instance report for the management packs.

Run the report directly from the Reporting section in the Operations console. If you run the Data Volume by Workflow and Instance report directly, you should set the parameters of the report to customize the results; this report is designed to provide details for information in the Data Volume by Management Pack report and so the default parameter settings may not provide the information you are looking for.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: You can use the following parameters to customize the results of the Data Volume by Workflow and Instance report:

maml:listItem.maml:para: From: The date and time provided in this parameter will be used as the start time for the report.
To: The date and time provided in this parameter will be used as the end time of the report.
Time Zone: This parameter is used to indicate which time zone to use for the from and to parameters.

Aggregation: This parameter sets the interval that will be used for aggregating the report results. The options provided are Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly and Yearly. It is recommended that you use larger aggregations for larger time spans to ensure the charts provided in the report are readable.
Data types: This parameter controls which types of data to include in the volume calculations. Consider the following uses for this parameter:
Including all data types will provide a report that shows total volumes. This can be used to pinpoint management packs and data types are contributing the most to volumes.
Selecting a single data type allows for a more focused data volume analysis, such as identifying top alert-generating management packs or top discovery data-generating management packs.

Show Top: The value passed in this parameter is used to limit the number of management packs returned in the report results. For example, a value of "10" will limit the report results to the top 10 management packs. After the total data volumes are calculated for the data types selected, the list or management packs is sorted by total volume and filtered to include only the top # number of rows, where # is the value provided in this parameter

Management group: Use this list to select the management groups for which data should be queried from the data warehouse. By default, this list includes all of the management groups which have data in the data warehouse.

Management packs: Use this parameter to select one, several, or all management packs to be included in the report. By default, all management packs for which there is data in the data warehouse are included.

maml:section.maml:title: Additional Information
maml:section.maml:para: The tables in this report have a column labeled "Type" and a column labeled "Discovery, Rule or Monitor". The type indicates whether the workflow is a rule, monitor, or discovered type.
The Count by Discovered Type, Rule, or Monitor table summarizes the following information:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Percent of total data volume per management pack. The values that are displayed are rounded to 2 decimals. The grand total is computed using raw values. The Count by Management Pack total is the total for the rows displayed.

Trend. An arrow (up, down, or sideways) indicates that the volume of data during the period of the report is increasing, decreasing, or stable. The grand total row indicates that the total volume of data is increasing, decreasing, or stable.
Count

maml:section.maml:para: The Count by Class Instance table lists the class type, full name or path, and display name for each instance that generated data. For each instance, the table displays:

maml:listItem.maml:para: Percent of total data volume per management pack. The values that are displayed are rounded to 2 decimals. The grand total is computed using raw values. The Count by Management Pack total is the total for the rows displayed.

Trend. An arrow (up, down, or sideways) indicates that the volume of data during the period of the report is increasing, decreasing, or stable. The grand total row indicates that the total volume of data is increasing, decreasing, or stable.
Count

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Agents by Health State report provides lists of agents broken down the state that the agents are in.

maml:section.maml:title: Configuration
maml:section.maml:para: You can use the following parameters to customize the results of the Agents by Health State report:

maml:listItem.maml:para: States: This parameter controls which states to include in the report. The options are Unavailable, Critical, Warning and Success. One table will be generated, per each state that is selected. Each table will contain the list of the agents that are in that state according to the data in the data warehouse.
Include Maintenance Mode: This parameter controls whether agents that are in maintenance mode should be shown in the report or not.

Objects: This parameter controls which agents to include in the report. The object picker accepts both groups and agents (a.k.a "Health Service" objects) directly. Note: If a group is selected in the object picker, the report will only include the Health Service objects that are in the group. Regardless of anything else that the group contains, if the group contains no health service objects, then nothing will be added from the group.

DisplayString.Name: System Center 核心监视报表
DisplayString.Description: 此管理包定义的报表用于与 System Center 核心监视相关的分析和计划。

DisplayString.Name: System Center 核心監視報表
DisplayString.Description: 此管理組件定義用於 System Center 核心監視相關分析和規劃的報表。

DisplayString.Name: Sestavy System Center Core Monitoring Reports
DisplayString.Description: Tato sada Management Pack definuje sestavy používané pro analýzu a plánování související se sadou System Center Core Monitoring.

DisplayString.Name: System Center-Kernüberwachungsberichte
DisplayString.Description: Von diesem Management Pack werden Berichte zum Analysieren und Planen im Zusammenhang mit der System Center-Kernüberwachung definiert.

DisplayString.Name: Informes de supervisión principal de System Center
DisplayString.Description: Este módulo de administración define los informes usados para el análisis y la planificación relativos a la supervisión principal de System Center.

DisplayString.Name: Rapports d'analyse principale System Center
DisplayString.Description: Ce pack d'administration définit les rapports utilisés pour l'analyse et la planification liées à l'analyse principale System Center.

DisplayString.Name: System Center Core Monitoring-jelentések
DisplayString.Description: Ez a felügyeleti csomag a System Center Core Monitoring szolgáltatással kapcsolatos elemzéshez és tervezéshez határoz meg jelentéseket.

DisplayString.Name: Report di monitoraggio principale di System Center
DisplayString.Description: Questo Management Pack definisce i report utilizzati per l'analisi e la pianificazione relativa al monitoraggio principale di System Center.

DisplayString.Name: System Center コア監視レポート
DisplayString.Description: この管理パックは、System Center コア監視関連の分析と計画に使用されるレポートを定義します。

DisplayString.Name: System Center 핵심 모니터링 보고서
DisplayString.Description: 이 관리 팩은 System Center 핵심 모니터링과 관련된 분석 및 계획에 사용되는 보고서를 정의합니다.

DisplayString.Name: Rapporten voor System Center-kernbewaking
DisplayString.Description: Dit management pack definieert rapporten die worden gebruikt voor analyse en planning met betrekking tot System Center-kernbewaking.

DisplayString.Name: Raporty monitorowania rdzenia oprogramowania System Center
DisplayString.Description: Ten pakiet administracyjny definiuje raporty służące do analizy i planowania związanego z monitorowaniem rdzenia oprogramowania System Center.

DisplayString.Name: Relatórios do Monitoramento Principal do System Center
DisplayString.Description: Este pacote de gerenciamento define relatórios usados para análise e planejamento relacionados ao Monitoramento Principal do System Center.

DisplayString.Name: Relatórios do System Center Core Monitoring
DisplayString.Description: Este pacote de gestão define os relatórios utilizados para análise e planeamento relacionados com o System Center Core Monitoring.

DisplayString.Name: Отчеты о мониторинге ядра System Center
DisplayString.Description: Этот пакет управления содержит отчеты, используемые для анализа и планирования и относящиеся к мониторингу ядра System Center.

DisplayString.Name: Kärnövervakningsrapporter i System Center
DisplayString.Description: Det här hanteringspaketet definierar rapporter som används för analys och planering i samband med kärnövervakning i System Center.

DisplayString.Name: System Center Temel İzleme Raporları
DisplayString.Description: Bu yönetim paketi, System Center Temel İzleme ile ilgili analiz ve planlamada kullanılan raporları tanımlar.
